title: DIN rounded
content:
Hey This is my first post. This site looks great! Anyway I was just wondering if DIN rounded was available to purchase anywhere.

Thanks for your help,

Steve
author: TEKNISION

comments.content:
Perhaps this would work?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/din-17-sb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052742/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/din-17-sb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/din-17-sb/")

Although, if you're looking for a rounded, industrial/template font, Bryant is the way to go:

[http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052742/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html")

FF DIN Rounded is in production. Until then, marc's suggestions are good. Also: [Gravur Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052742/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/)
also relevant to this old thread is [Gotham rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052742/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100030)
Great suggestions. I'm glad you steered me to Bryant instead of DIN marcox.

[Old thread day indeed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150126052742/http:/typophile.com/node/7059), Jan. What’s happening!? ;^)

And Nick, you're right. I’m surprised myself! :^P
